CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 25, 1941, pg. 14, reads: "Crime Breeding Communities Such As These In Pittsburgh Give Birth To 'Native Sons' Of All Races, Creeds And Colors - Unhealthy - Electric lights and bathrooms are novelties in 99 percent of these homes. Oil lamps and outhouses, like those above, are constant threats in way of fires and epidemics.  In some cases as many as two and three families use one 'rest-room.'  The lives of the occupants are constantly in danger, what with houses virtually piled on top of each other and oil lamps serving as excellent fire starters.  Despite their circumstances, people living in these homes are God-fearing and sincere.  Most homes have reminders like the one above, urging the practice of Christian fellowship....  Photos by Harris and [illegible]"
TitMainTitle: Oil lamp and sign inscribed "Notice! Please say nothing in this house, that you would not in the church, please do nothing in this house that you would not in the church" on table in bedroom
